summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary from August 30, 2021, with an individual referred to as III. The interviewee discusses their relationship with a victim (referred to as [REDACTED]), the victim's experiences with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and the victim's emotional state and reluctance to discuss details of the abuse. The document also mentions the victim's interactions with Prince Andrew and the interviewee's understanding of the Maxwell-Epstein relationship.

persons.name: III
persons.context: Individual interviewed by the FBI who is close to a victim of Epstein and Maxwell. They discuss the victim's suffering, lack of faith in justice, and their own understanding of the relationships involved.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described by the interviewee as Epstein's girlfriend and a 'monster'. The interviewee states Maxwell was like a 'buffer of safety' and that Epstein was a 'godfather figure' to her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a 'godfather figure' to Maxwell, weird, eccentric, and rich. The interviewee recounts that the victim used to speak favorably of him because he bought her things.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the victim sat next to on Epstein's plane, according to what the victim told the interviewee.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Present during the interview of III, as indicated in the document header.

connections.description: III is close to the victim, talks to her regularly for venting, but they avoid discussing the details of her abuse experiences.
III describes Epstein as a 'godfather figure' to Maxwell and thinks she was probably his girlfriend. Maxwell is seen as a 'buffer of safety' for Epstein.
The victim was abused by Epstein. She initially spoke favorably of him because he bought her gifts, but later referred to the experiences as abuse.
The victim is described as angry and disgusted with Maxwell, referring to her as a 'monster'.
The victim told III that she sat next to Prince Andrew on Epstein's plane.

events.title: FBI Interview of III
events.description: FBI agents and an AUSA interview III about their knowledge of a victim's experiences with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Epstein Sends Massage Therapist
events.description: III recalls that in 2019, Epstein sent a massage therapist to the victim's house when she was living with III.

events.title: Victim's Realization of Abuse
events.description: III states it became real for the victim that she was abused about ten years prior to the interview (around 2011), though she had hoped it didn't happen up until about the 2000s.

events.title: Epstein Under House Arrest
events.description: III indicates that when Epstein was under house arrest (circa 2008-2009), it was maybe when they (III and the victim) started to talk about the abuse.

events.title: Victim's Flight with Prince Andrew
events.description: The victim told III that she was on Epstein's plane and sat next to Prince Andrew.

keyFacts: A key victim in the case is deeply suffering, lacks faith that justice will be served, and is reluctant to discuss the explicit details of her abuse even with close confidants.
The interviewee (III) describes Ghislaine Maxwell as Epstein's probable girlfriend and a 'buffer of safety' for him, while the victim views Maxwell as a 'monster'.
The victim reportedly sat next to Prince Andrew on Jeffrey Epstein's plane, according to her account to the interviewee.
The victim's initial favorable view of Epstein (because he bought her gifts like a dress) contrasts with the later realization and disclosure of abuse.
The document is heavily redacted to protect victim and witness identities, with key names replaced by 'III' and blank spaces, indicating ongoing sensitivity and protective orders.
